## Market

+ Most global employees exhibit disengagement [@albrecht2015employee]
+ Cost in US is billions (lost productivity; @johnson2004otherwise)
+ $\frac{2}{3}$ US companies [measure engagement](https://decision-wise.com/resources/articles/truth-employee-engagement-measurement-practices/#:~:text=Most%20Companies%20Measure%20Employee%20Engagement%20Every%20Year&text=45%20percent%20of%20companies%20reported,and%2014%20percent%20measure%20sporadically.)
  + $\frac{3}{4}$ utilize third-party administration   
  + Cost estimates vary widely:
    + [\$3,000 to \$30,000](https://www.driveresearch.com/market-research-company-blog/the-cost-of-outsourcing-an-employee-survey/#:~:text=by%20Jamie%20Bjarnar,to%20info@driveresearch.com.)
    + [£10,000 to £100,000](https://www.etsplc.com/blog/how-much-does-an-employee-survey-cost-a-buyer-s-guide-to-pricing#:~:text=The%20longer%20your%20survey%2C%20the,on%20your%20key%20performance%20indicators.&text=The%20higher%20the%20number%20of,and%20more%20data%20to%20analyse.&text=The%20more%20cross%2Dtabulation%20reports,weigh%20up%20against%20different%20groupings.)

::: {.notes}
Anecdotally $7,000 seems to be a low number for smaller (~500 employee) organizations. Market pricing on smaller organizations seems disconnected from fully IS integrated large organization operations.
:::

# eRg Engagement 

## Actionable Components & Motives

::: {layout="[60,40]"}
::: first-column
+ [Dedication]{.moonfont2} -- strongly involved in one's work and experiencing a sense of significance, enthusiasm, and challenge
+ [Energy]{.moonfont2} -- high levels of energy and mental resilience while working
+ [Focus]{.moonfont2} -- fully concentrated and engrossed in one's work
:::

::: second-column
+ [Thinking]{.moonfont2} -- thoughts about work
+ [Feeling]{.moonfont2} -- attitude toward work
+ [Doing]{.moonfont2} -- actions at work
:::
:::

```{r norms2, warning=FALSE, echo=FALSE}

pilot <- read.csv("content\\product\\data\\qualtrics_pilot_data.csv")[-c(1:2),c(14:15)]  ## n = 232 (November 2021)
qualtrics1 <- read.csv("content\\product\\data\\Engagement+(Attitudinal)_October+12,+2021_08.02.csv")[-c(1:2),c(14:15)]
qualtrics2 <- read.csv("content\\product\\data\\Engagement+(Substantive)_October+12,+2021_08.01.csv")[-c(1:2),c(14:15)]
prolific1 <- read.csv("content\\product\\data\\inprogress.csv")[-c(1:2),] ## lat/long missing
prolific2 <- read.csv("content\\product\\data\\initial_data_screen.csv")[-c(1:2),c(14:15)]
snowball <- read.csv("content\\product\\data\\lookie.12.2.csv")[-c(1:2),c(14:15)]

library(rgeolocate)     ## installed old version 4/12/23

ip_lst = prolific1$V6

prolific1_est <- maxmind(ip_lst, "content\\product\\data\\GeoLite2-City.mmdb", 
        fields=c("latitude", "longitude"))

names(prolific1_est)[1] <- "LocationLatitude"
names(prolific1_est)[2] <- "LocationLongitude"

together <- rbind(pilot, qualtrics1, qualtrics2, prolific2, snowball, prolific1_est)

library(leaflet)
library(maps)  ## us.cities data

together$`LocationLongitude` <- round(as.numeric(as.character(together$`LocationLongitude`)),1) ## mask actual geographic location
together$`LocationLatitude` <- round(as.numeric(as.character(together$`LocationLatitude`)),1)

ergIcon <- makeIcon(
  iconUrl = "https://ergreports.com/images/erg2.png",
  iconWidth = 60, iconHeight = 50,
  iconAnchorX = 30, iconAnchorY = 30,
)

## create leaflet map
leaflet(together) %>% 
  setView(lng= -86, lat=36, zoom=4) %>%
  addTiles() %>%
  addMarkers(data=together, ~LocationLongitude, ~LocationLatitude, clusterOptions=markerClusterOptions()) %>%
  addProviderTiles("Stamen.TonerBackground")

```
